The deal-breaker:
You are not going to be able to accurately predict the exact speed of your long run from your GPS.
Your GPS (either built-in, or a separate GPS receiver) is not a linear instrument.  You will not be able to accurately predict your speed from the GPS data in the same way that you would predict your speed from your speedometer.  It will be a lot like doing a metabolic fitness test, but with GPS.
The best bet:
If you have a GPS, use it in tandem with your running watch.  You will get a much better estimate of your running speed than you will get with just your GPS.  This is because the GPS knows how long it takes you to run a certain distance and how fast you run.  It will use this information to give you a more realistic prediction of your speed.  However, if you have a GPS and want to do a long distance run, your best bet is to use it in tandem with your running watch.
The reason:
The reason GPS is not a good predictor of your speed is because of the fact that it is not a linear instrument.  This is a fact that is very well known by experienced runners.  It is not only not a linear instrument with a GPS receiver, it is not even linear with a GPS receiver.  You will get a better estimate of your speed if you use the GPS in conjunction with your running watch.  Even if you have a GPS, you still need to use it in conjunction with a running watch.

How to run Grunt from the command line?

grunt is part of the Node.js package system, not the npm package system.
npm install grunt

would install grunt globally, which is usually not what you want. Instead, you want to install grunt globally to your system.

npm install -g grunt

user_prompt: what is elasticsearch?
assistant_prompt:
?

A:


The R Server
-------------------

The R server is a set of programs that can be used to view,
manage, and execute R code on a remote machine.

The R server is an R system,
and is intended to be used in conjunction with an R system.
The R server can be used to run R code on a remote machine,
but it is not necessarily necessary to use an R system.

The R server is a server that provides a connection to a
remote machine, with a protocol similar to that used by
the R IDE, but a different set of commands.

To use the R server, you must install the Rserver package.
This package is not installed by default on R systems;
it is only installed when you first log in as an R user.
To install the Rserver package, use the install.packages
method.

The R server is responsible for the following:

  - establishing and maintaining a connection to the remote machine
    from the local machine.

  - managing and executing R code on the remote machine.

  - providing access to the remote machine for other R users.

The R server also provides a set of command-line tools
that can be used by other programs to interact with the remote
machine.  These tools can be used by programs that do not
need to use the R server directly, but are required to
communicate with the remote machine over the network.

For more information about the R server and other topics,
see the R Server Guide,
available in the R Documentation Package.

To run R code on a remote machine, use the rserver()
function from the R server package.

Note that the R server is also used by the R IDE,
and is considered a separate object.

See also:

* the R Server Reference (which is part of the R documentation package)
* the R Server Manual
* the R Server FAQ

How to Choose a CMS - bbr
http://www.mvcforum.com/showthread.php?t=10628

======
bbr
I found this post very useful. The important point is to understand what your
users need, how they will use your application, and how you can set the
possibilities and constraints.

For example, I have an app that allows users to send messages to other users.
Users are able to create a message and then send it to a group of users. They
can also send a message to a specific user, but for these cases, the user
would need to be able to click on a button to send the message.

This is an example of a requirement, and thus a constraint. But I would
probably want to have a much more complex app that allows users to send
messages to groups, send a message to a specific user, but also allow users to
create a message and send it to themselves.

Or, if you have a very well-defined business process, you could create a
simple app that allows only one task to be performed in a day. If the user
needs to send a message to a group, then he can do it, but if he needs to
send a message to a user, then he can do it.

It's up to the user to decide what type of app they need.
